csg.genetics.ld package¶

Submodules¶

csg.genetics.ld.pyld module¶

class csg.genetics.ld.pyld.Haplotypes¶

Bases: csg.genetics.ld.pyld.Haplotypes

This class represent phased genotypes at chromosomal region.

size¶

int – number of variants (M).

chrom¶

list – list of length M with chromosome names.

position¶

list – list of length M with chromosomal positions (long type).

ref¶

list – list of length M with reference alleles (string type).

alt¶

list – list of length M with alternate alleles (string type).

haplotypes¶

numpy.ndarray – M x N matrix of genotypes (coded as 0 and 1), where N is number of individuals times 2.

class csg.genetics.ld.pyld.LD¶
add_vcf(vcf)¶

Opens VCF file with phased genotypes.

Phased genotypes must be stored in VCF format: in single VCF file, or multiple VCF files split by chromosome. Each VCF file must be indexed using tabix. If VCF files are split by chromosome, then envoke this method for each file individually.

Parameters:vcf (string) – path to VCF file which is compressed using bgzip and indexed using tabix.
Raises:Exception – Raises an exception if: (a) no VCF header; (b) numbers of individuals in multiple VCF files are different.
compute_freq(haplotypes)¶

Computes alternate allele frequencies for set of variants.

Parameters:haplotypes (Haplotypes) – genotypes of variants.
Returns:array of size haplotypes.size with alternate allele frequencies.
Return type:numpy.ndarray
compute_r_cross(haplotypes1, haplotypes2)¶

Computes r coefficient of linkage-disequilibrium between pairs of variants in two sets.

Parameters:
  • haplotypes1 (Haplotypes) – genotypes for variants in first set.
  • haplotypes2 (Haplotypes) – genotypes for variants in second set.
Returns:

haplotypes1.size x haplotypes2.size matrix of r coefficients of linkage-disequilibrium.

Matrix rows correspond to variants in first set, while columns correspond to variants in second set. Both rows and columns have the same order as variants in haplotypes1 and haplotypes2 objects, correspondingly.
Return type:

numpy.ndarray
compute_r_pairwise(haplotypes)¶

Computes r coefficient of linkage-disequilibrium between all variants in the given set.

Parameters:haplotypes (Haplotypes) – genotypes for a set of variants.
Returns:
haplotypes.size x haplotypes.size symmetric matrix of r coefficients of linkage disequilibrium.
Matrix rows and columns have the same order as variants in haplotypes object.
Return type:numpy.ndarray
get_region_haplotypes(chrom, start_position, end_position)¶

Reads phased genotypes at specified chromosomal region.

Parameters:
  • chrom (string) – chromosome name.
  • start_position (long) – start position of chromosomal region in base pairs.
  • end_position (long) – end position of chromosomal region in base pairs.
Returns:

phased genotypes at specified chromosomal region.
Return type:

Haplotypes
get_variant_haplotypes(chrom, position)¶

Reads phased genotypes at specified chromosome and position.

Parameters:
  • chrom (string) – chromosome name.
  • position (long) – chromosomal position in base pairs.
Returns:

phased genotypes at specified chromosome and position.
Return type:

Haplotypes
get_variant_haplotypes_strict(chrom, position, ref, alt)¶

Reads phased genotypes at variant that matches specified chromosome, position, reference and alternate alleles.

Parameters:
  • chrom (string) – chromosome name.
  • position (long) – chromosomal position in base pairs.
  • ref (string) – reference allele.
  • alt (string) – alternate allele.
Returns:

phased genotypes at specified variant.
Return type:

Haplotypes
release_vcfs()¶

Closes all opened VCF files.
